Connection

Class MySQLcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • Connection.MySQLcon

  • public class MySQLcon
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for the Connection for MySQl here and of course for getting the Data for the Synchronising with PostgreSQL
    Author:
    AHMED ALY, Daniel Dimitrijevic

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(java.lang.String query)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        You use this function if you have a INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP, ALTER or a GRANT query.
        Parameters:
        query - here you give the query
        Returns:
        either the row count for INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP, ALTER or a GRANT statements, or 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the SQL query is wrong
